fields.description: If a commit message contains a string like "CR-FE-123" and a string "FE-123" it will not be included in the search for commits for a specific issuekey (from JIRA for example).
fields.summary: Commit messages that contain both "prefix-issuekey-number" and "issuekey-number" are not included in queries for an issue key.

fields.description:
Just observed on a dogfood instance (fisheye.diac) on git repository, but same may potentially happen on other SCMs too, most likely Mercurial.  Indexer may not notice repository changes and won't index them until new changes appear in the remote repository.  Manually triggering incremental index won't help too.

Most likely scenario that occured:
 # new changes were pushed to remote git repository
 # FishEye started indexing them, first step is to run fetch to update local clone (this seems to have finished correctly)
 # next step is to compare branches and tags in local repository against heads in remote repository.  But FishEye was restarted at this point (notice local clone was updated already)
 # after restart on every incremental index scan FishEye repeats steps 2 and 3.  Until step 2 brings new changes step 3 would assess that local and remote heads are the same and there is nothing to be indexed.

h3. Workaround
Push any changes to remote repository to recover
fields.summary: indexer may miss repository changes

fields.description:
FishEye indexing stops, and never resumes when errors such as this happens while pulling from a Mercurial repository on Windows:

{noformat}
2015-01-16 00:05:34,797 WARN  [IncrPing2 XXXXXX] fisheye IndexingPingRequest-doRequest - Exception during FishEye Incremental Indexing of XXXXXX: com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Unable to pull from remote repository: ssh://hg@XXX/XXX/XXX
 - [abort: no suitable response from remote hg!]
 - remote:   Preferred POSIX equivalent is: /cygdrive/c/EI/Atlassian/AppData/fisheye_inst/data/auth/XXXX
remote:   CYGWIN environment variable option "nodosfilewarning" turns off this warning.
remote:   Consult the user's guide for more details about POSIX paths:
remote:     http://cygwin.com/cygwin-ug-net/using.html#using-pathnames
remote: ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
{noformat}

FishEye should abort this operation and retry, or continue indexing other repositories.

Issue keys in quicksearch should be links

fields.description:
We have fisheye configured to update its user information from our JIRA instance (since Fisheye doesn't support nested groups).  JIRA syncs with our Active Directory instance.

Although the every-15-minute synching is occuring and new users are getting created in FIsheye,  when an email address is changed, that change is NOT picked up in the auto-synching.

Only by manually selecting a resync are email addresses getting updated.

Similar to FE-2857.

JIRA version 6.3.12.
fields.summary: fisheye not picking up changes to email addresses from JIRA

fields.description:
DefaultRepositoryAdminService.create() lock configuration too late to prevent creation repositories with duplicated names.  Steps to reproduce:
 * insert a breakpoint in DefaultRepositoryAdminService.create() method somewhere between check if repo exists and creation of the repo.  Ensure only current thread is stopped
 * create 2 distinct repositories of the same name, stopping each thread on a breakpoint
 * resume both threads
Two repositories exists with same name and different definitions in config.xml.  Repository admin shows only one of those repositories.

When fixing consider validating config.xml for duplicated repository names, log a warning perhaps or even drop duplicated repositories.

Safe steps to recover:
 * identify repositories of duplicated names in config.xml
 * rename/delete them to avoid name conflicts
 * note this would trigger reindex, cross repository reindex may require reindexing too to remove old data
 * authentication data may be lost, too
fields.summary: FishEye allows creation of repositories with duplicated names under race condition

fields.description:
Login attempts for users managed externally (i.e. JIRA/Crowd) logs the user's password in FishEye logs if the Network Traffic is enabled.

I think the password should be sanitized, because:
* This information is generally not important for troubleshooting of most issues.
* Users would have sensitive information exposed in the logs.
* FishEye administrators could enable Network Traffic, being able to see other users passwords just by checking the logs.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Connect FishEye to JIRA for user management.
* In FishEye, enable debug logging with Network Traffic.
* Attempt to login with a user managed by JIRA. The following shows up in FishEye logs:

fields.summary: REST API for adding repositories to a project

fields.description:
Sometimes it was observed that the number of commits referring a JIRA issue, shown in the Development Panel, isn't properly updated. Still, when opening the panel, all the commits are listed.

E.g.: there are 4 commits linked to a JIRA issue. A new commit is performed against a repository, referring this JIRA issue. After this commit is indexed, the Dev Panel still shows 4 commits, but when opening it, 5 commits are listed.

*Workaround*
I observed that right after restarting the repository in FishEye the number of commits was updated properly. After this the number got updated right away for new commits, so I couldn't determine for how long it works after the repository is restarted.
fields.summary: Number of commits in Dev Panel (JIRA) isn't updated

fields.description:
Our company uses multiple Atlassian products, like Jira, Confluence, Bamboo and Crucible. For source code control we are using PlasticSCM since it's the best state of the art tool for that. We have experiences with git, subversion, cvs and mercuical but all of them are not a patch on PlasticSCM. Unfortunately non of the Atlassian products supports PlasticSCM directly.

Currently we are using the PlasticSCM plugins provides by Codice. But most of the time there are not as nice integrated as the repositories which are directly supported by Atlassian. 

We think it is necessary for Atlassian to support PlasticSCM natively, since it's the best SCM system on the market, at least in our opinion. The native support would add value to all Atlassian products.

Especially Fisheye would benefit of a PlasticSCM support, since there isn't a plugin available yet. If you would integrate PlasticSCM support to Fisheye, we would immediatly buy a License for our Company. And I am sure others will do the same!
fields.summary: Adding Plastic SCM repository support

{code}

h3. Workaround #1

Increase the heap size

h3. Workaround #2 

Disable implicit committers. 

JVM property {{fisheye.enable.implicit.committers}}

 Whether user-committer mapping should query repository cache to find implicit committers. Enabled by default.
     * In case of case of large repositories with many commit authors fetching this data may take more time,
     * prolonging sql queries and thus consuming all database connections available - as this search is executed
     * inside an sql query which collects both explicit committers (from database) and implicit ones (from infinitydb).

Note: this is an undocumented property, not listed on https://confluence.atlassian.com/fisheye/jvm-system-properties-960155689.html

fields.description:
After upgrading to 3.6.2, these WARN messages can be seen:
{noformat}
2014-12-23 13:53:48,479 WARN [main ] org.hibernate.mapping.RootClass RootClass-checkCompositeIdentifier - composite-id class does not override equals(): com.atlassian.fecru.usersettings.UserSetting
2014-12-23 13:53:48,479 WARN [main ] org.hibernate.mapping.RootClass RootClass-checkCompositeIdentifier - composite-id class does not override hashCode(): com.atlassian.fecru.usersettings.UserSetting
{noformat}

After discussing this with the developers, we've realized that these messages are caused by an incomplete implementation of the [UserSettingsService|https://docs.atlassian.com/sal-api/2.12.1/sal-api/apidocs/com/atlassian/sal/api/usersettings/UserSettingsService.html] class in the Shared Access Layer (SAL) library that was added in FishEye 3.6.0.

Although these WARN messages are harmless, they identify development work that needs to be completed in the future.
fields.summary: Incomplete implementation of UserSettingsService in SAL causing WARN messages

fields.description:
Due to a greedy repository scheduling algorithm we use when scheduling repository scanning, if the requested poll period is short (e.g. default = 60 seconds) and checking for changes takes a time that's longer than the poll period (slurp), a new request IncrementalPingRequest will be scheduled as soon as the previous one is done. 

This combined with RepositoryHandle#processPingRequests not releasing the executor until all ping requests are processed, will cause the repository never to release the executor, and prevent other repositories from being updated.



h4. Workaround 

- Increase the poll period of affected repositories, e.g. from the default 60 seconds to 5 minutes.
- Increase the number of incremental indexing threads (if your system has enough resources to do so).
fields.summary: Setting a short poll period, and having repositories that take a long time to check for changes, might cause other repositories never to be scheduled

fields.description:
According to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Text+file+size+limiting], the default file size limit should be 5MB.

However, Maximum Indexable File Size at {{Administration >> Repository Settings >> Defaults >> Other Settings}} default value is 0.1MB

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Install new FishEye/Crucible 3.6.2
# Make sure that the repository default does not have the value for Maximum Indexable File Size in {{config.xml}}
# Add a SVN repository
# Commit a file with the size 2MB into the repository
FishEye/Crucible able to show the diff of the file at http://localhost:8060/changelog/svnrepo?cs=<revision>
# Check the Maximum Indexable File Size at {{Administration >> Repository Settings >> Defaults >> Other Settings}}
It is showing 0.1MB
# Check the Maximum Indexable File Size at {{Administration >> Repository Settings >> Repositories >> svnrepo >> Other Settings}}
It is showing "Use the system default settings for max indexable settings" (0.1MB)
However, it is still able to index 2MB file
# Navigate to {{Administration >> Repository Settings >> Defaults}}
# Click on the button "Save changes" on any of the tab
It will save the default selected option "0.1MB" for Maximum Indexable File Size. Can confirm this by checking {{config.xml}}
# Change only a line in the 2MB file and commit it
FishEye/Crucible can still show the diff of the file
# Restart the repository
# Change only a line in the 2MB file and commit it again
FishEye/Crucible can't show the diff of the file with the following info:
{noformat}
test.txt is too large to show a diff.
To see the diff between revisions 24 and 25 of test.txt download them and use a diff tool. For more information about text file size limits and how to modify them see the documentation.
{noformat}
However, FishEye/Crucible can still show the diff of the same file for the older revision (eg: 23-24) that is committed before the restart
# Change only a line in the 2MB file and commit it again
# Before the above commit is indexed by FishEye/Crucible, set the Maximum Indexable File Size at {{Administration >> Repository Settings >> Repositories >> svnrepo >> Other Settings}} to be 5MB
# Restart the repository
FishEye/Crucible still can't show the diff at step 12
# Change only a line in the 2MB file and commit it again
FishEye/Crucible can show the latest diff now
fields.summary: Maximum Indexable File Size by default saved as 0.1MB

fields.description: It will be good if the Charset option is allowed to be set for all the different source code management systems and not only subversion.
fields.summary: Allow default charset to be set all the different source control system

fields.description:
HTR:

{code}
$ curl 'http://mbp-swiety:6060/foo/avatar/val?s=25' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, sdch' --compressed -v -o /dev/null 
> GET /foo/avatar/val?s=25 HTTP/1.1
> User-Agent: curl/7.37.1
> Host: mbp-swiety:6060
> Accept: */*
> Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, sdch
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK

$ curl 'http://mbp-swiety:6060/foo/avatar/val?s=25' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, sdch' -H 'If-None-Match: ngzgn02-gzip"' --compressed -v -o /dev/null 
> GET /foo/avatar/val?s=25 HTTP/1.1
> User-Agent: curl/7.37.1
> Host: mbp-swiety:6060
> Accept: */*
> Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, sdch
> If-None-Match: ngzgn02-gzip"
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{code}

The second request should recognize the etag and return 304 without re-rendering the image.

Caused by Jetty modifying the etag on output, but failing to strip the modifications on subsequent requests. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=441897
fields.summary: Avatar (possibly other) ETag headers seem to be improperly processed, leading to re-requesting unchanged resources
dfgdfg

fields.description: When using the 'Rescan' maintenance option for a Perforce repository to rescan already indexed changelists, a request to reindex all the changelist in the repository is triggered, which might take a long time for larger repositories.
fields.summary: A request to rescan Perforce changelists triggers reindexing of all changeset data

fields.description:
When using JIRA for user management if a user is renamed in JIRA and then synchronized into FishEye this user appears to be only renamed in FishEye (the new username is listed), but looking at the DB shows that actually the previous user in FishEye is disabled, and a new one with the new username was created.

The user is then shown as deleted in reviews created by him.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Connect FishEye to JIRA for user management, configured as follows:
!jirauser.png|thumbnail!
# Rename a user in JIRA.
# Run a Re-Sync in FishEye.
# Notice the users seems to be renamed, but in DB a new user was created and the original user was disabled.
fields.summary: Renaming users in JIRA creates new users in FishEye

fields.description:
The suggestion is to change the screenshot contained in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Integrating+FishEye+with+Stash].

The way it is currently it gives the impression that, by adding a repository from Stash, its name in FishEye will be preceeded by the Project name in Stash. It actually just adds the repository with the same name it has in Stash.

fields.description:
Currently authentication must be configured for each repository.

If the same credentials are used for hundreds of repositories and customers need to update them, this will require a lot of manual work.

It would be much better if it were possible to save these credentials somewhere in order to update them once and for all repositories that use them.
fields.summary: Allow global credentials for repository authentication

fields.description:
We have discovered and fixed a vulnerability in our fork of WebWork. Attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that use this framework. The attacker needs to be able to access the FishEye web interface.

All versions of FishEye up to and including 3.6.1 are affected by this vulnerability. The vulnerability has been fixed in recent releases 3.5.5 and 3.6.2.

For additional details see the full advisory.
fields.summary: OGNL Double Evaluation Vulnerability

fields.description: While the version of commons-fileupload used in fecru is not vulnerable to CVE-2014-0050 it would still be good to upgrade to version 1.3.1.
fields.summary: Upgrade apache commons-fileupload to version 1.3.1

fields.description:
Regardless of using the Quick Search at the top right corner of the screen or the advanced search, FishEye is not allowing searching partial strings. 

For example, in a local instance:
* If "committing" is searched, things containing "committing" are returned.
* If "commit" is typed, *only* things containing "commit" are returned, but it should return things containing "committing" as well.

Please see the images attached.
fields.summary: Allow searching partial strings

fields.description:
If you have a repository in FishEye, {{Repo}} for example, and you try to add the {{repo}} repository from Stash, the add fails with the error {{Repository 'repo' already exists.}} It affects FishEye version 3.6.2 and newer.

h5. Actual Behaviour
When adding the repository, it fails with an error saying that the repository already exists.

h5. Expected Behaviour
If the repository already exists, the user should be prompted to change the name of the repository. 

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a repository in FishEye called {{Repo}}.
# Create a repository in Stash called {{repo}}.
# Try to add the repository in FishEye from the {{Stash}} tab.
fields.summary: Adding Stash Repository Fails When Repository Name Exists With Different Case in FishEye

fields.description:
Deleting branches often results in Fisheye running very slow diffs for each delete which will delay indexing of the reset of the repository (i.e. recent changes.)

The only workaround is to exclude these manually, however, adding excludes will trigger a re-index, which is not ideal when adding these exclusions often.
fields.summary: Handle SVN branch deletions better

fields.description:
Even though most recent changesets are indexed even before the whole repo is indexed (SVN) the watch notifications are not sent while the Initial Indexing is still running. Furthermore, they are also not sent after it finishes, being sent only when a new changeset is indexed by the Incremental Indexing, then the notification is sent for the new changeset, as well as for those commited during Initial Indexing.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Add yourself as a watcher in a repository.
# Trigger a re-index (this will trigger an Initial Indexing).
# While Initial Indexing runs, perform a commit. No notifications will be sent, even when the Initial Indexing finishes.
# After the repo is indexed, perform a commit (which will be indexed by the Incremental Indexing). Both notifications will be sent.

The suggestion is to send notifications for new commits even when the Initial Indexing is still running.
fields.summary: Send watch notification during Initial Indexing

fields.summary: [JFP] Fix Crucible search from JIRA Project Overview

fields.description:
FishEye is nowadays only compatible with Oracle 11g.

Customers are willing to migrate to 12g but this is not a [Supported Platform|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+platforms] yet.
fields.summary: Support Oracle 12

fields.description:
The GUI is inconsistent when performing reviews based on patch-files. The menus and user interface indicate that a user can select to view more lines of code than Crucible knows about. The JSON response indicate this by the string:

"You can not move the base revision, as this patch file is not anchored to a repository. Crucible can only display the contents of the uploaded patch file."

However, this is not reflected in the browser, so the user doesn't know about it.

Further, the view menu indicates that 20 lines of code is shown even though only 3 lines are showing. This is not the expected behavior from a user perspective.

Browser: Firefox 33.0
OS: Linux, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
Repository-type: GIT
fields.summary: GUI Indicates 20 Lines Being Shown Even Though Only 3 Lines are Shown in Reviews

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a REST resource that represents the repositories that are attached to a Crucible project. Doing a POST on this resource would add an existing FE repository to the project. Doing a GET would return a list of the repositories. DELETE on some sub-resource (aka repository) would also be possible. 

Right now I can only create and edit repositories, and I can create a project. But I cannot edit much of the project's properties, such as the attached repositories.
fields.summary: Make editing of repositories in project editable via REST API

fields.description:
Fisheye process Git commits in blocks so two long unrelated ancestry lines which belong to the same branch (eg. master) may lead to "Branch master has been moved" situation. That forces branch membership to be rebuilt and results in indexing performance degradation especially visible for large repositories.

Situation may be reproduced with [^git-branch-moved.zip] repository
{code}
$ git log --oneline --graph --all
* 51bcc43 a.txt 3
*   6c9f121 Merge branch 'branch-x' int master
|\  
| * 9671aa4 x.txt 2
| * 126e049 x.txt 1
* | 8daac0f a.txt 2
|/  
* b3cbb20 a.txt 1
{code}
and block size set to 1.

For such set up I was able to get message
{code}
2014-12-03 09:32:30,784 INFO  [InitPing3 git-branch-moved ] fisheye CommonChangeSetDAO-clearOnBranchesIfRefWarped - Branch master has been moved from 9671aa4ceecda63ba832cc43398deac49e4e879f to 8daac0fab4890fb1e83640a37cbf5048f89abcad, which is not a descendant of its old value. Rebuilding branch memberships for the branch
{code}

h3. Workaround
The possible workaround is to increase block size from default 1000 to some bigger value which prevents "Branch master has been moved" appearing in the logs.
fields.summary: Slow Git indexing: "Branch master has been moved"

fields.description: Currently there is a predefined set of values that this setting can currently have (*0.1m, 0.5m, 1m, 5m, 10m, 20, 50, 100m*), it would be nice to be able to set a custom value for this.

fields.description:
SVNKit is very slow when listing all properties on repository. 

For repository generated by [^gen-large-svn.py] (1 mln paths) 

{code}
$ time svn proplist -R -r 1001 file:///home/czawadka/repos/large-svn/large-svn@1001
real    0m23.147s
user    0m18.781s
sys     0m4.275s

$ time jsvn proplist -R -r 1001 file:///home/czawadka/repos/large-svn/large-svn@1001
real    61m52.926s
user    59m14.678s
sys     3m6.295s
{code}
That means SVNKit (jsvn) is 400x slower then the native (svn) implementation. 

SVNKit is aware of that fact as it prepared FAQ how to deal with slow proplist - https://web.archive.org/web/20140923170354/http://wiki.svnkit.com/SVNKit_FAQ#Q:_Recursive_repository_properties_fetch.2BAFw-list_operation_is_slow._Is_it_possible_to_make_it_work_faster.3F

h3. Workaround
To overcome the issue [Native Subversion Client|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Native+Subversion+Client] should be configured in Fisheye/Crucible.
fields.summary: Slow listing SVN properties with SVNKit

fields.description:
On DogFood instance and FE-git repository consisting of ~45k commits and ~210k revisions the following EyeQL query {code}select revisions limit 1{code} takes ~2 seconds. Adding {{ORDER BY}} ie. {code}select revisions order by date limit 1{code} causes request to time out after 60 secs.

Customers are reporting issues with their repositories as well with 1st stage of the query (filtering only, no ordering) running for ~90 seconds and seconds stage (ordering) not finished due to timeouts on proxy servers.

fields.description: For Fisheye indexed changesets committed by a committer with special characters in his/her name (e.g. {{ user }} ) the link to this committer's commits would not work, page would render error. It seems that the link is encoded properly, for the above example it is: {{./committer/cs/%3C%2Fa%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert%28%27f%27%29%3C%2Fscript%3E%20user%20%3Calerted2%40example.com%3E}} but the page rendering it incorrectly decodes committer name as {{<}} and failing to find it renders error: {quote} The requested resource cannot be found. Committer < does not exist in repository cs {quote} This was identified by [~rstephens] when reviewing FECRU-2624, see https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-6991#c74313. In order to reproduce: # commit a change as a committer with username of {{ user }}, ensure this gets indexed by FishEye # navigate to activity page of the repository the change was checked into # find the committer name in the activity pane and click on it. Although the URL is encoded properly, expect error message mentioned above

fields.description:
When configuring an external database in FishEye and specifying an existing database (which already contains data) FishEye doesn't check this database actually contains something and just overrides its data with the data from the database currently in use.

There should be some sort of warning, or even something that stops the user to migrate to a non-clean database.

h3. Workaround
If you are trying to update the connection details to the current database (e.g. from IP to server name), you can use the following:
# Stop FishEye/Crucible
# Edit the {{FISHEYE_INST/config.xml}} file to update the repository details
# Start FishEye/Crucible
fields.summary: Adding existing external database overrides all data without any warning

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce;

Create a Project and add a repository as its default repo, 
Apply LDAP restrictions to the repo so that access to the repo is restricted to the group(s) specified. 
When LDAP restrictions are in place the default repo for the repository changes to another repo name (one that is set as the default for another Project) and when trying to change the default repo back the desired repo is not available in the drop down list.

Remove the LDAP restrictions and every thing returns to normal.

fields.description: It is standard functionality in Fisheye to derive the Jira issues associated with a changeset from the commit comment, so EyeQL should provide the return clause "issues", which contains a comma-separated list of Jira issue keys (no guarantee that the issues actually exist in Jira).

fields.description: EyeQL should support selecting reviews, with appropriate conditions (e.g. "author = ...", "project = ...") and return clauses (e.g. "reviewID", "status").
fields.summary: As a user of EyeQL, I want to select reviews.

fields.description:
Although "changeset" and "revision" are synonymous in Mercurial and Git, fisheye interprets the latter to mean "file changed in a changeset". EyeQL is currently limited to selecting "revisions".

Workarounds, such as including a return clause like "count(distinct reviews)", are not adequate due to restrictions about what can be returned when aggregates are used. For example, a query such as "select revisions group by changeset return csid,reviews,count(distinct reviews)" is not accepted.

The correct solution is to provide "select changeset".
fields.summary: As a user of EyeQL, I want to select changesets.

fields.description:
* Conditions such as "project = ", "project in (...)" should be provided, which are evaluated as a shorthand way of referring to the repos included in a Crucible project.
* The return clause should provide "project".
fields.summary: As a user of EyeQL, I want my query to use Crucible projects in conditions.

fields.description:
* The repo level search can remain with implicit scope of one repo.
* The repositories tab should offer a search entry, which opens into EyeQL search, with scope of all repos.
* Conditions such as "repo = ...", "repo in (...)", etc. should be available.
* The return clause should include "repo".

fields.description:
If the process of starting a repository at startup of FishEye throws an exception, then that repository's InfinityDB instance is left open, even though the repository is not in the STATE_RUNNING state.

This means that when the user tries to start the repository from the admin UI a spurious locking exception is thrown.

e.g. initial exception:

{noformat}
2014-10-15 07:18:03,907 WARN  [RepoStarter-5 storesvn ] fisheye DefaultRepositoryManager$3$1-call - Problem starting repository storesvn
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2RepositoryEngine.getEarliestInState(Svn2RepositoryEngine.java:175)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.svn.Svn2RepositoryEngine.initialiseRepositoryStatus(Svn2RepositoryEngine.java:127)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryEngine.start(RepositoryEngine.java:218)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryHandle.run(RepositoryHandle.java:404)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.DefaultRepositoryManager.runRepository(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:352)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.DefaultRepositoryManager$3$1.call(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:403)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.DefaultRepositoryManager$3$1.call(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:399)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.NamedExecution.call(NamedExecution.java:31)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.DefaultRepositoryManager$3.call(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:399)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.DefaultRepositoryManager$3.call(DefaultRepositoryManager.java:395)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:724)
{noformat}

will result in this Exception when the user tries to start the repo:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException: com.cenqua.obfuscate.idbn5uu6o.locking.FileLockException: Cannot lock file in exclusive mode - already open internally

fields.description:
If a customer has a large amount of repositories of which they wish to add a start revision to force Fisheye to only index from a certain point (say 6 months ago) they have to manually add a Start Revision to each repository.

It would be useful to be able to set a Global start revision over all repositories based on a time frame i.e. 6 months,12 months etc. - (For none SVN repos)
fields.summary: Ability to set a Global Start revision/time restrained Start Revision

fields.description: For git/mercurial committer names instead will be shown in the annotation/blame column, even if there are users mapped to those committers.
fields.summary: Diff annotations don't show mapped users for git/mercurial

fields.description:
Diffing a large file in FishEye or in a Crucible review (tested with 20mb text file) causes OutOfMemory Java Heap Space errors. 

This is occurring with git repositories.

Increasing the java heap space is the current workaround.
fields.summary: Diffing Large Files Causes OutOfMemory Errors (Git/CVS)

fields.description:
It would be good for FishEye/Crucible to auto rescan when the changelist description is re-edited rather than manually triggering rescan from the FishEye administration.

It is already possible to request a rescan via REST: https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fecru.html#rest-service-fecru:admin:repositories:name:rescan-metadata or Repository Admin UI
fields.summary: Auto Reindex When Submitted Changelist Description Is Re-Edited In Perforce

fields.description:
The implementation of com.atlassian.sal.api.user.UserManager#resolve, doesn't consider the 'force lowercase' 
setting when processing the username provided in the 2LO request. This will cause the request to continue being processed as anonymous (as the 2lo validation succeeds, but it didn't have a valid username).

This potentially affects other auth methods that try to resolve a username (like trusted apps). 3LO is not affected, as the exact-cased username is stored with the 3LO token when creating the token.

Effects of this might include requests made from other applications with such a configuration to be treated as anonymous requests, and show incomplete or no data, depending on the request type and Fisheye's configuration.

A workaround is to use 3-legged OAuth for such configurations.
fields.summary: 2LOi requests made from an application that has the username in a different case than FishEye/Crucible aren't authenticated properly even if 'force lowercase' is set

fields.description: This should work with no problems -- we just need to explicitly allow it, and test with it.
fields.summary: Support Oracle encoding AL16UTF16

fields.description:
we have seen a support case where the URL generated in projectReviewsReport.tag can have a ';jsessionid=...' appended to it, even though web.xml should forbid this. This causes an error:

{noformat}
2014-09-23 11:05:15,745 ERROR [qtp2024674927-19317 ] com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.DispatcherUtils DispatcherUtils-serviceAction - Could not find action
There is no Action mapped for namespace /cru and action name reviewreportimg;jsessionid=xpyqk26c7xwkc8hmdubmpbqf. Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xwork.xml and also if such an action class exists. Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded. - [unknown location]
at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxy.<init>(DefaultActionProxy.java:75)
{noformat}

It may be associated with failures to authenticate with Crowd.
fields.summary: jsessionid can be incorrectly appended to URLs generated by <c:url...
Upgrade svnkit to 1.8.7 when released

fields.description:
The option "Periodically synchronise users with JIRA" under the "JIRA / Crowd Authentication Settings" mentions that the "(you can still manually sync from the Security page)".

The page mentioned is unclear and it should mentions that the manual sync can be performed from the following page {{Security Settings > Authentication}} instead.
fields.summary: Update The UI Description For The JIRA / Crowd Authentication Settings Page

fields.description: The admin hash is not being sanitised when support zip is created. It would be good if the admin hash is sanitised as well during the creation of the support zip.
fields.summary: Sanitise Admin Hash In The Config.xml When Creating Support Zip.

fields.description: It would be good to have an option to override default repository exclude in FishEye/Crucible. E.G. when a folder path {{test/*}} is excluded to be indexed from the repository, however this setting can be override based on repository config.
fields.summary: Allow repositories to not inherit default includes/excludes

fields.description:
In {{System Info}}, the value of {{Total memory}} is the value of {{<heap-used>}} in {{application.xml}}.

When looking at {{Total Memory}}, if the memory moves into gigabytes, there is not much granularity to see the actual value being using. We round-up to the nearest gigabyte.

For example, is 1.5GB is used, it will show 1G.

In the following screen shot we can see {{Total Memory}} shown as 9G:
!Screen Shot 2016-02-05 at 12.17.32 PM.png|width=400!
However, {{application.xml}} from the same FishEye instance, created by the Support Tools Plugin almost at the same time, reports:
{code:xml}
<heap-used>8,531,214,336</heap-used>
{code}
In this case the heap used is around 8.53G and, as we round-up to the nearest gigabyte, {{Total memory}} is showing up as 9G.

More granularity should be added (i.e. 1.5G or 1.50G) to make the metric more useful for administrators.

This should be applied to {{Free Memory}} as well.
fields.summary: More Granularity in Total Memory / Free Memory in System Info

fields.description: Currently FeCru is using 3.0.7, which has at least one moderately serious bug that can make scripts load in the wrong order: [PLUGWEB-136|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGWEB-136]. (This is the cause of the JS errors mentioned in [UPM-4697|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-4697], although we may be able to change UPM's implementation to avoid the problem.)
fields.summary: Bump Web Resources version to 3.1.0

fields.description: Nowadays the scheduled backups take some time to run, some customers would like a plugin like [Stash DIY Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Using+Stash+DIY+Backup] to backup FeCru.
